resources.string: On-going statistics of the established OpenVPN connection
Status changes of the OpenVPN connection (connecting, authenticating,…)
Icon of app trying to use OpenVPN for Android

By proceeding, you are giving the application permission to completely control OpenVPN for Android and to intercept all network traffic.Do NOT accept unless you trust the application. Otherwise, you run the risk of having your data compromised by malicious software."
Pausing connection in screen off state: less than %1$s in %2$ss
Warning: Persistent tun not enabled for this VPN. Traffic will use the normal Internet connection when the screen is off.
Reread (%d) log items from log cache file
VPN permission revoked by OS (e.g. other VPN program started), stopping VPN
Restarting OpenVPN Service (App crashed probably crashed or killed for memory pressure)
Refusing to open tun device without IP information
Could not add DNS Server \"%1$s\", rejected by the system: %2$s
Could not configure IP Address \"%1$s\", rejected by the system: %2$s

No DNS servers being used. Name resolution may not work. Consider setting custom DNS Servers. Please also note that Android will keep using your proxy settings specified for your mobile/Wi-Fi connection when no DNS servers are set.
Failed to open the tun interface
On some custom ICS images the permission on /dev/tun might be wrong, or the tun module might be missing completely. For CM9 images try the fix ownership option under general settings
Package %s is no longer installed, removing it from app allow/disallow list
No allowed app added. Adding ourselves (%s) to have at least one app in the allowed app list to not allow all apps
Cannot make sense of %1$s and %2$s as IP route with CIDR netmask, using /32 as netmask.
Got interface information %1$s and %2$s, assuming second address is peer address of remote. Using /32 netmask for local IP. Mode given by OpenVPN is \"%3$s\".
VPN topology \"%3$s\" specified but IP Config %1$s %2$s looks more like an IP address with a network mask. Assuming \"subnet\" topology.
Preferred native ABI precedence of this device (%1$s) and ABI reported by native libraries (%2$s) mismatch

Cannot access the Android Keychain Certificates. This can be caused by a firmware upgrade or by restoring a backup of the app/app settings. Please edit the VPN and reselect the certificate under basic settings to recreate the permission to access the certificate.

Some versions of Android 4.1 have problems if the name of the keystore certificate contains non alphanumeric characters (like spaces, underscores or dashes). Try to reimport the certificate without special characters
No CA Certificate returned while reading from Android keystore. Authentication will probably fail.
You must select a User certificate
You must select a CA certificate
Config uses option tls-remote that was deprecated in 2.3 and finally removed in 2.4
Profile specified in shortcut not found
Waiting for user permission to use VPN API
VPN API permission dialog cancelled.\n\nPlease grant this permission to use VPN services

If you did not get a VPN confirmation dialog, you have \"Always on VPN\" enabled for another app. In that case only that app is allowed to connect to a VPN. Check under Settings-> Networks more .. -> VPNS
Your image does not support the VPNService API.
Missing user certificate or user certifcate key file
You need to define and enable at least one remote server.
Error signing with Android keystore key %1$s: %2$s
No internet connectivity. Please try again.
You have already connected to a VPN server. Please disconnect from it before connecting to a new VPN server.
This data will be added soon.
You currently do not have any VPN usage
Share this link with your friend to invite them to Sentinel dVPN app

Hey, check out this new dVPN Android app. Use my Referral ID to get free tokens when you Sign Up.

Referral ID: %1$s

Link: %2$s

Use my Referral ID to get free tokens when you Sign Up.\nReferral ID: %1$s

Decentralized VPN right at your finger tips
Unable to reach server. Please retry.
Enter the Wallet Address obtained from the Sentinel Network App.

You have already claimed the tokens. Your tokens will deposited shortly.
Address: %1$s
SNC Referral ID: %2$s
SLC Referral ID: %3$s

1. The referral ID for the given address is, %1$s.

2. If this referral ID is different from that shown in the Sentinel Network App from GitHub, contact us on our official Telegram Group (link in the side menu).

3. Tap on Confirm, if you would like to link the entered address with the Referral ID in this app to receive earned tokens.
Congratulations! Your Sentinel Free dVPN dApp and Sentinel Network dVPN dApp are now linked with the entered address. Tokens will be deposited after the mapping phase of 1 week is completed.
A new version has been released and is available for download.\n\nKindly download and install the latest version in order to use the app.
You have entered an invalid Referral ID. Please enter valid Referral Id
You have not entered a Referral ID.\n\nDo you wish to continue without applying a Referral ID?
There are no items to display.
There are no unoccupied VPNs available at the moment.
Have a Referral ID?\nApply it to get added bonuses.

1. Download the Sentinel Network App from GitHub by tapping on the \"Download\" button. Skip this if you already have the app.\n2. Create an address and paste the wallet address by tapping on the \"Enter Address\" button.

Welcome to the Sentinel Referral Utility Drop.

Users who test this Lite Client will be able to claim their reward(s) after 21 or so days from the time that they had first installed the application and consumed a minimum of 100 MB of data from the Sentinel dVPN community hosted network.

The referral air drop reward schedule is as follows: 

500 SENT : For downloading the Sentinel Android Google Play Client and using 100 MB of data 

300 SENT : For downloading the Sentinel Network Client which includes a mobile ERC20 wallet. This client will have to be downloaded by users in order to claim $SENT

200 SENT : For every referral who downloads either SLC or SNC
A loss of network connection was detected.The VPN connection has been dropped.\nPlease reconnect.
Please rate your experience with the previous dVPN session
